Title: Assassin's Creed
Content: In February 2016, Ubisoft announced they would not be releasing a new game in 2016 in order to step "back and [re-examine] the "Assassin's Creed" franchise... [and take the] year to evolve the game mechanics and to make sure we're delivering on the promise of "Assassin's Creed" offering unique and memorable gameplay experiences". On the decision, Guillemot said that "Ubisoft started to question the annualized franchise with the release of "Assassin's Creed Unity", and the fact that "Assassin's Creed Syndicate" had "a slower launch than expected". Guillemot added that "by moving away from the annual iterations of the franchise, it will give the "Assassin's Creed" teams more time to take advantage of new engines and technology". "Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag"s director Ashraf Ismail, commented on an interview that he and the team would be interested in doing an "Assassin's Creed" game in an Ancient Egyptian setting, along with reiterating an earlier statement that a female leading character was not an impossibility for the series. In May 2017, Ubisoft confirmed the development of "Assassin's Creed Origins". It was announced to be set in the Ptolemaic Egypt in June 2017. The game was released worldwide on October 27, 2017 for PlayStation 4, Xbox One and Windows.

The Ganges Delta arises from the confluence of the rivers Ganges, Brahmaputra, and Meghna rivers and their respective tributaries. Document ID: 2
Title: Historia ya Bangladesh
Content: Uamuzi wa kuathiri kizigeu cha Bengal ulitangazwa mnamo Julai 1905 na Viceroy wa India, Lord Curzon. Sehemu hiyo ilifanyika mnamo 16 Oktoba 1905 na kutenganisha maeneo ya mashariki ya Waislamu kutoka maeneo ya Magharibi ya Hindu. Mkoa wa zamani wa Bengal uligawanywa katika majimbo mawili mapya "Bengal" (iliyojumuisha Bengal Magharibi na mkoa wa Bihar na Orissa) na Bengal ya Mashariki na Assam na Dacca kama mji mkuu wa mwisho. Kuhesabu kulipandishwa kwa sababu za kiutawala: Bengal ilikuwa kijiografia kama Ufaransa na ilikuwa na idadi kubwa zaidi. Curzon alisema mkoa wa Mashariki ulipuuzwa na kutawaliwa. Kwa kugawanya mkoa, utawala ulioboreshwa unaweza kuanzishwa Mashariki, ambapo baadaye, idadi ya watu ingefaidika na shule mpya na fursa za ajira. Wahindu wa West Bengal ambao walitawala biashara ya Bengal na maisha ya vijijini walilalamika kwamba mgawanyiko huo ungewafanya wachache katika mkoa ambao ungejumuisha mkoa wa Bihar na Orissa. Wahindi walikasirishwa na kile walichotambua kama sera ya "mgawanyiko na sheria".

Document ID: 2
Title: Kanisa la Notre Dame de Lourdes (Fall River, Massachusetts)
Content: Na upotezaji wa mashehe wa kanisa hilo walihamishwa kwenda kwa kituo cha watoto yatima cha Mtakatifu Joseph hadi kanisa jipya liweze kujengwa. Jumamosi na Jumapili mashehe ilifanyika katika Shule ya Upili ya Askofu Connolly. Wakati magofu yalipotafutwa iligundulika kuwa kidogo sana kutoka kwa moto. Dirisha moja lenye glasi, "ndege kwenda Misri", iliokolewa uharibifu kwa sababu ya kuwa katika Connecticut kwa ukarabati. Notre Dame ya tatu ilibuniwa na kujengwa karibu na dirisha hili. Malaika watatu ambao walikuwa wamepamba taa ya patakatifu na mishumaa mbili, ingawa katikati ya moto, walifanikiwa kuishi kwa inferno. Hizi pia ni sehemu ya kanisa mpya. Monument ya Moyo Mtakatifu pia ilinusurika kwa miujiza hiyo moto hata ingawa ilikuwa karibu na kanisa. Haikuwa hadi 1986 ambapo kanisa jipya lilijengwa na tayari kutumika. Mwelekeo wa jengo jipya ni kubadili kile cha zamani kilikuwa. Makanisa mapya "Front" yanakaa katika nyayo za makanisa ya zamani "nyuma". Mnamo mwaka wa 2012, ilifunuliwa kuwa parokia ya Notre Dame de Lourdes ingekuwa ikiungana na parokia ya dhana ya kutokuwepo katika Mto Fall. Hii ilitokea mnamo Juni 2012 na watakuwa wakitumia Notre Dame kama kanisa lao, wakichukua jina la St. Bernadette.

claim: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child”
question_en: Is sperm donation safe?
report_en: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child” [1]. To reduce genetic risks such as accidental consanguinity, many jurisdictions cap the number of families or children a single donor can father [1]. While these rules help safeguard recipients, enforcement gaps exist because a bank may ship sperm abroad and donors can give samples at multiple clinics, potentially bypassing local limits [1]. Therefore, the practical level of safety hinges on choosing a reputable, regulated bank that complies with disease testing, genetic screening, and traceability standards, and on confirming that the donor has not exceeded recommended offspring limits.
all_claims: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child” [1].

Title: Sperm bank
Content: Where sperm banks are allowed to operate they are often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child, but which may also provide a compromise between the conflicting views which surround their operation. A particular example of this is the control which is often placed on the number of children which a single donor may father and which may be designed to protect against consanguinity. However, such legislation usually cannot prevent a sperm bank from supplying donor sperm outside the jurisdiction in which it operates, and neither can it prevent sperm donors from donating elsewhere during their lives. There is an acute shortage of sperm donors in many parts of the world and there is obvious pressure from many quarters for donor sperm from those willing and able to provide it to be made available as safely and as freely as possible.

question_en: Is sperm donation safe?
report_en: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child” [1]. To reduce genetic risks such as accidental consanguinity, many jurisdictions cap the number of families or children a single donor can father [1]. While these rules help safeguard recipients, enforcement gaps exist because a bank may ship sperm abroad and donors can give samples at multiple clinics, potentially bypassing local limits [1]. Therefore, the practical level of safety hinges on choosing a reputable, regulated bank that complies with disease testing, genetic screening, and traceability standards, and on confirming that the donor has not exceeded recommended offspring limits.

claim: Tylenol was introduced in 1955 by McNeil Laboratories
question_en: When was Tylenol introduced?

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Tylenol (brand)
Content: The brand was introduced in 1955 by McNeil Laboratories, a family owned pharmaceutical manufacturer. Two brothers took over the company from their father that year, and that year one of them learned about paracetamol, which was not on the US market at that time. To avoid competing with aspirin, they marketed it as a product to reduce fever in children, packaging it like a red fire truck with the slogan, "for little hotheads". The name "Tylenol" and the generic name "acetaminophen" were generated by McNeil from the chemical name of the drug. Johnson & Johnson bought McNeil in 1959, and one year later the drug was made available over the counter.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Burson-Marsteller
Content: Katika mkutano wa waandishi wa habari wa Burson-Marsteller mnamo Novemba 1982, Johnson & Johnson walianzisha ufungaji mpya wa uthibitisho, na kuwa kampuni ya kwanza kuanzisha ufungaji wa muhuri mara tatu, ambao baadaye ukawa kiwango cha tasnia. Mkutano huo uliwapa Johnson & Johnson fursa ya kutangaza kwamba walikuwa wakibadilisha vidonge vya Tylenol kwenye soko na watachukua nafasi ya tylenol ambayo watumiaji walikuwa wameitupa. Kwa kuongezea, Johnson & Johnson walichapisha matangazo na kuponi kwa watumiaji kutumia katika kuchukua nafasi ya Tylenol ambayo ilikuwa imetupwa nje na kutoa matangazo na matangazo ya kuchapisha yakishukuru umma kwa "ujasiri wao na msaada". Ndani ya wiki sita za kuanzishwa kwa mauzo ya bidhaa iliyowekwa tena ya Tylenol ilirudi katika kiwango cha zamani. Mnamo 1983, Burson-Marsteller alipewa tuzo ya fedha kwa "usimamizi wa shida ya nje" kwa kazi yake na Johnson & Johnson. Kampuni hiyo ilirudishwa nyuma kushughulikia usimamizi wa shida wakati wa mzozo wa pili wa Tylenol, ikihusisha utapeli wa cyanide huko New York mnamo 1986.

Title: Numerical digit
Content: From India, the thriving trade between Islamic sultans and Africa carried the concept to Cairo. Arabic mathematicians extended the system to include decimal fractions, and Muḥammad ibn Mūsā al-Ḵwārizmī wrote an important work about it in the 9th  century. The modern Arabic numerals were introduced to Europe with the translation of this work in the 12th century in Spain and Leonardo of Pisa's "Liber Abaci" of 1201. prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Antarctica
Content: Positioned asymmetrically around the South Pole and largely south of the Antarctic Circle, Antarctica is the southernmost continent and is surrounded by the Southern Ocean; alternatively, it may be considered to be surrounded by the southern Pacific, Atlantic, and Indian Oceans, or by the southern waters of the World Ocean. There are a number of rivers and lakes in Antarctica, the longest river being the Onyx. The largest lake, Vostok, is one of the largest sub-glacial lakes in the world. Antarctica covers more than , making it the fifth-largest continent, about 1.3 times as large as Europe. Document ID: 2
Title: Warren B. Hamilton
Content: Hamilton aliongoza sherehe ya uwanja wa watu wawili huko Antarctica (Oktoba 1958-Januari 1959) kwa mwaka wa kimataifa wa jiografia, na akazindua uelewa mpya wa Antarctica. Alikuwa wa kwanza kutumia jina la Milima ya Trans-Antarctic (miaka miwili baadaye, iliyoandaliwa kama Milima ya Transantarctic) kwa aina hiyo ya km 3,500. Hamilton alitambua kuwa sekta kubwa ya safu hii ilikuwa na miamba ya granitic ya kipekee kama ukanda wa Adelaide Orogenic wa Australia Kusini. Fossils zinazohusiana na umri tofauti huko Antarctica, Australia, na kusini mwa Afrika ziliunganisha zaidi mabara haya, na kuunga mkono maelezo ya wakati huo ya drift ya bara. Kabla ya kusafiri kwenda Antarctica, Hamilton ndivyo alivyoelezea baadaye kama "chumbani," akijua kuwa Jiolojia ya Hemisphere ya Kusini ilitoa ushahidi wenye nguvu unaopendelea kuteleza kwa Bara. Alirudi Antarctica kwa kazi ya shamba mnamo 1963 na 1964 katika sehemu zingine za Milima ya Transantarctic, pamoja na zile zilizokuwa zikiendelea na trakti zingine za Australia. Alichunguza pia katika ushahidi wa uwanja wa Drift huko Australia na Afrika Kusini, akiunganisha kazi yake na ile ya watafiti wengine kuonyesha jinsi Antarctica na mabara mengine ya Gondwana yalitengana.

Title: 'Salem's Lot
Content: Politics during the time influenced King's writing of the story. The corruption in the government was a significant factor in the inspiration of the story. Of this he recalls,
In 2005, Centipede Press released a deluxe limited edition of "'Salem's Lot" with black and white photographs by Jerry Uelsmann and the two short stories "Jerusalem's Lot" and "One for the Road", as well as over 50 pages of deleted material. The book was limited to 315 copies, each signed by Stephen King and Jerry Uelsmann. The book was printed on 100# Mohawk Superfine paper, it measured , was over thick, and weighed more than . The book included a ribbon marker, head and tail bands, three-piece cloth construction, and a slipcase. An unsigned hardcover edition limited to 600 copies, was later released. Both the signed and unsigned editions were sold out. In an interview with the printed trade journal "Fine Books & Collections", King said of the illustrated folio version of his "'Salem's Lot", "I think it's beautiful!" A trade edition was later released.

Title: Paka kwenye kofia
Content: Kulingana na Judith na Neil Morgan, kitabu hicho kiliuza vizuri mara moja. Toleo la biashara hapo awali liliuza wastani wa nakala 12,000 kwa mwezi, takwimu ambayo iliongezeka haraka. Duka la Idara ya Bullock huko Los Angeles, California, liliuza nje ya agizo lake la kwanza, nakala ya nakala 100 kwa siku na haraka ikapanga tena 250 zaidi. Wargans huonyesha nambari hizi za mauzo kuwa "uwanja wa michezo-wa-kinywa", wakisema kwamba watoto walisikia juu ya kitabu hicho kutoka kwa marafiki wao na kuwachanganya wazazi wao ili wainunue. Walakini, toleo la shule la Horton Mifflin halikuuza pia. Kama Geisel alivyosema katika maelezo mafupi ya Jonathan Cott ya 1983 ya yeye, "Horton Mifflin ... alikuwa na shida kuiuza kwa shule hizo; kulikuwa na Dick na Jane wa kujitolea, na kitabu changu kilizingatiwa kuwa safi sana na kisicho na heshima. Lakini Bennett Cerf katika Nyumba isiyo ya kawaida alikuwa ameuliza haki za biashara, na ilichukuliwa tu kwenye duka la vitabu." Geisel aliwaambia Morgans, "Wazazi walielewa bora kuliko watu wa shule umuhimu wa msomaji wa aina hii."

The U.S. federal government or "national debt" was $21.1 trillion in May 2018, just over 100% GDP. Using a subset of the national debt called "debt held by the public", U.S. debt was approximately 77% GDP in 2017. By this measure, the U.S. ranked 43rd highest among 2017 nations. Debt held by the public rose considerably as a result of the Great Recession and its aftermath. It is expected to continue rising as the country ages towards 100% GDP by 2028.

claim: Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion
question_en: Does cognitive dissonance factor into pluralistic ignorance?
report_en: Yes; research indicates that cognitive dissonance can play a role in pluralistic ignorance, but its influence varies by context. Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion [1]. Female students, however, did not show this attitude change, indicating that dissonance pressure was weaker where drinking norms were less central to identity [1]. Moreover, subsequent work on non-drinkers such as vegetarians shows that pluralistic ignorance can also emerge from the topology of social networks without invoking cognitive dissonance, demonstrating that dissonance is a common but not universal mechanism behind the phenomenon [1].
all_claims: Yes; research indicates that cognitive dissonance can play a role in pluralistic ignorance, but its influence varies by context.

Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion [1].
Female students, however, did not show this attitude change, indicating that dissonance pressure was weaker where drinking norms were less central to identity [1].

Moreover, subsequent work on non-drinkers such as vegetarians shows that pluralistic ignorance can also emerge from the topology of social networks without invoking cognitive dissonance, demonstrating that dissonance is a common but not universal mechanism behind the phenomenon [1].
claims_retained: Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion [1].
Female students, however, did not show this attitude change, indicating that dissonance pressure was weaker where drinking norms were less central to identity [1].

Moreover, subsequent work on non-drinkers such as vegetarians shows that pluralistic ignorance can also emerge from the topology of social networks without invoking cognitive dissonance, demonstrating that dissonance is a common but not universal mechanism behind the phenomenon [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Pluralistic ignorance
Content: Prentice and Miller found that, on average, private levels of comfort with drinking practices on campus were much lower than the perceived average. In the case of men, they found a shifting of private attitudes toward this perceived norm, a form of cognitive dissonance. Women, on the other hand, were found to have an increased sense of alienation on the campus but lacked the attitude change detected in men, presumably because norms related to alcohol consumption on campus are much more central for men than for women. Research has shown that pluralistic ignorance plagues not only those who indulge, but also those who abstain: from gambling, smoking and drinking and among some who follow vegetarianism. The latter has found that pluralistic ignorance can be caused by the structure of the underlying social network, not cognitive dissonance.

Title: Mawasiliano ya watu
Content: Wakati watu wanapokutana na habari mpya au uzoefu mpya, huweka habari hiyo kulingana na mitazamo yao, mawazo, na imani. Ikiwa mkutano mpya hauendani na mawazo yao ya preexisting, basi dissonance inaweza kutokea. Wakati dissonance inatokea, watu wanahamasishwa kupunguza dissonance wanayopata kwa kuzuia hali ambazo zinaweza kusababisha kutokujali au kuongeza dissonance. Kwa sababu hii, dissonance ya utambuzi inachukuliwa kuwa hali ya kuendesha ambayo inahimiza motisha ya kufikia konsonanti na kupunguza dissonance.
Mfano wa dissonance ya utambuzi itakuwa ikiwa mtu anashikilia imani kwamba kudumisha maisha ya afya ni muhimu, lakini hawafanyi kazi mara kwa mara au kula afya. Wanaweza kupata uzoefu kati ya imani zao na matendo yao. Ikiwa kuna kiwango kikubwa cha dissonance, wanaweza kuhamasishwa kubadilisha mitazamo yao na kufanya kazi zaidi au kula vyakula vyenye afya. Wanaweza pia kuwa na mwelekeo wa kuzuia hali ambazo zitaonyesha ukweli kwamba mitazamo na imani zao haziendani, kama vile kuzuia mazoezi au kusoma ripoti za afya.Kuhusu nadharia ya utambuzi, kuna aina tatu za uhusiano wa utambuzi: uhusiano wa konsonanti, uhusiano wa dharau, na uhusiano usio na maana. Urafiki wa konsonanti ni wakati vitu viwili, kama imani na vitendo vyako, viko katika usawa na kila mmoja au sanjari. Mahusiano ya dissonant ni wakati vitu viwili haviko katika usawa na husababisha dissonance. Mahusiano yasiyofaa ni wakati mambo mawili hayana uhusiano wa maana na mwenzake, hayahusiani na hayasababishi.

Title: Kathleen Beedles
Content: Kuanzia 1999 hadi 2001, Beedles alifanya kazi kama mshirika wa hadithi kwenye "Coronation Street" kabla ya kuhamia "Emmerdale" kama Mhariri wa Hadithi. Mnamo 2005, Beedles aliteuliwa mtayarishaji wa safu ya runinga ya runinga ya Uingereza "Emmerdale", akichukua nafasi kutoka kwa Steve Frost. Alikuwa amefanya kazi kama mtayarishaji na mhariri wa mfululizo wa sabuni ya ITV kabla ya kuchukua jukumu hilo. Kuweka wakati wake kwenye sabuni, alikuwa na jukumu la hadithi nyingi kubwa, pamoja na hadithi ya Mlipuko wa Mto wa Kings River, na njama ya Tom King. Pia alikuwa na jukumu la yule aliyemuua Tom King? Hadithi ya hadithi, ambayo iliteuliwa kwa Best Storyline katika Tuzo za Sabuni za Uingereza za 2007. Chini ya umiliki wake Emmerdale aliteuliwa kwa BAFTA kwa miaka mitatu mfululizo, alishinda tuzo ya RTS na Tuzo ya Dijiti ya Matangazo kwa WHO iliua Tom King Online.

report_en: 5-Hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid (5-HETE) was first discovered and described in 1976 by the Nobel laureate Bengt I. Samuelsson and his colleagues, who identified it as a metabolite of arachidonic acid produced by rabbit neutrophils [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: 5-Hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid
Content: The Nobel laureate, Bengt I. Samuelsson, and colleagues first described 5("S")-HETE in 1976 as a metabolite of arachidonic acid made by rabbit neutrophils. Biological activity was linked to it several years later when it was found to stimulate human neutrophil rises in cytosolic calcium, chemotaxis, and increases in their cell surface adhesiveness as indicated by their aggregation to each other. Since a previously discovered arachidonic acid metabolite made by neutrophils, leukotriene B4 (LTB), also stimulates human neutrophil calcium rises, chemotaxis, and auto-aggregation and is structurally similar to 5("S")-HETE in being a 5-("S")-hydroxy-eicosateraenoate, it was assumed that 5-("S")-HETE stimulated cells through the same cell surface receptors as those used by (LTB) viz., the leukotriene B4 receptors. However, further studies in neutrophils indicated that 5-("S")-HETE acts through a receptor distinct from that used by LTB as well as various other neutrophil stimuli. This 5("S")-HETE receptor is termed the oxoeicosanoid receptor 1 (abbreviated as (OXER1).
---

The Senate is composed of elected members - two from each region, the city of republican importance (Almaty) and the capital city of the Republic of Kazakhstan at joint sessions of the members of all representative bodies of respective regions, city of the republican importance and the capital city of the Republic.
Members of the Senate are elected on the basis of indirect suffrage by secret ballot. Half of elected members of the Senate are up for election every three years.
Fifteen members are appointed by the President of Kazakhstan with the view to ensure representation for all the diverse national, cultural components of society.
The term of office for the members of the Senate is 6 years.
According to constitutional norms in the Parliament of the fifth convocation, members of the Senate elected in 2011 and 2014 and those appointed by the President of the Republic of Kazakhstan in 2011 and 2013 continue to hold office.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Activity theory (aging)
Content: The activity theory, also known as the implicit theory of aging, normal theory of aging, and lay theory of aging, proposes that successful ageing occurs when older adults stay active and maintain social interactions. It takes the view that the aging process is delayed and the quality of life is enhanced when old people remain socially active. 
The activity theory rose in opposing response to the disengagement theory. The activity theory and the disengagement theory were the two major theories that outlined successful aging in the early 1960s. The theory was developed by Robert J. Havighurst in 1961. In 1964, Bernice Neugarten asserted that satisfaction in old age depended on active maintenance of personal relationships and endeavors.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Pearl Brewing Company
Content: In 1952, when the San Antonio Brewing Association changed its name to the Pearl Brewing Company, the triple Xs joined the Pearl name as a dominant image on the product and the company as a whole. The triple Xs were back on the company logo and were used on almost all of Pearl's advertisements. The Xs held this significant role to the end of production at the brewery in 2001, when the brewery closed its doors and the company logo was abandoned. As production of Pearl and Pearl Light spun up at Miller's Fort Worth facility, the product logos were redesigned. The updated label does not use the triple Xs, so a significant part of company identity has been virtually eliminated from the Pearl beers. However, Pearl's Country Club malt liquor still displays the XXXs in its logo.
Many people wonder where the Xs came from, and how were they ever used on beer. In truth, the three Xs are actually a quality rating system. The system was initially used in Europe during the 16th Century. As European royalty traveled their lands and visited neighboring counties, a royal courier was sent ahead of the official party. The courier's job was to sample beer at inns along the way. If the beer was only average, the courier would mark the inn's sign or door with a single X. If the inn's beer was deemed good, the sign or door would receive two Xs. A mark on an inn of three Xs meant that the beer inside was excellent, and a must-stop for the royal court as they passed through.
---

Triple XS inaweza kuwa imepita kutoka kwa kampuni na nembo za bia za Pearl, lakini haijatoweka kabisa. Mnamo miaka ya 1960, Pearl ilichukua Kampuni ya Goetz Brewing na kutengeneza pombe ya Klabu ya Malt moja ya bidhaa muhimu za Pearl. Wakati Club ya Nchi ilipokea bidhaa yake pekee ya bidhaa miaka michache baada ya ununuzi, ilipata Xs tatu katika nembo yake. XS ilikuwa katika kituo cha juu cha taji ya nembo. claim: Yes, a nerve fiber (axon) can be cut, either traumatically or intentionally during surgery, resulting in loss of motor or sensory function distal to the lesion
question_en: Can you cut a nerve fiber?
report_en: Yes, a nerve fiber (axon) can be cut, either traumatically or intentionally during surgery, resulting in loss of motor or sensory function distal to the lesion [1]. When this occurs, surgeons may attempt microsurgical repair or use autologous nerve grafts, which redirect regenerating donor axons through a graft conduit to re-establish connection with target muscles or skin [1]. Functional recovery after such repair is highly age-dependent: young children often regain near-normal nerve function, whereas patients over 60 years old typically recover only protective sensation, such as the ability to distinguish hot from cold or sharp from dull [1]. Adjunctive strategies like localized delivery of soluble neurotrophic factors are under investigation to accelerate axonal regeneration within grafts [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Nerve injury
Content: Surgery can be done in case a nerve has become cut or otherwise divided. Recovery of a nerve after surgical repair depends mainly on the age of the patient. Young children can recover close-to-normal nerve function. In contrast, a patient over 60 years old with a cut nerve in the hand would expect to recover only protective sensation, that is, the ability to distinguish hot/cold or sharp/dull. Many other factors also affect nerve recovery. The use of autologous nerve grafting procedures that involve redirection of regenerative donor nerve fibers into the graft conduit has been successful in restoring target muscle function. Localized delivery of soluble neurotrophic factors may help promote the rate of axon regeneration observed within these graft conduits.
---

Title: Neurolytic block
Content: Kizuizi cha neurolytic ni aina ya kizuizi cha ujasiri kinachojumuisha jeraha la makusudi la ujasiri kwa kufungia au inapokanzwa ("neurotomy") au matumizi ya kemikali ("neurolysis"). Uingiliaji huu husababisha kuzorota kwa nyuzi za ujasiri na muda mfupi (miezi michache, kawaida) kuingiliwa na maambukizi ya ishara za ujasiri. Katika taratibu hizi, safu nyembamba ya kinga karibu na nyuzi za mishipa, lamina ya basal, imehifadhiwa ili, kama nyuzi iliyoharibiwa, inasafiri ndani ya bomba lake la lamina ya basal na inaunganisha na mwisho sahihi, na kazi inaweza kurejeshwa. Kukata kwa upasuaji wa ujasiri (neurectomy), huweka mirija hii ya lamina ya basal, na bila wao kugeuza nyuzi zinazoweza kurudi kwenye miunganisho yao iliyopotea, baada ya muda neuroma chungu au maumivu ya deafferentation yanaweza kuibuka. Hii ndio sababu neurolytic kawaida hupendelea juu ya kizuizi cha upasuaji.

question_en: Can you cut a nerve fiber?
report_en: Yes, a nerve fiber (axon) can be cut, either traumatically or intentionally during surgery, resulting in loss of motor or sensory function distal to the lesion [1]. When this occurs, surgeons may attempt microsurgical repair or use autologous nerve grafts, which redirect regenerating donor axons through a graft conduit to re-establish connection with target muscles or skin [1]. Functional recovery after such repair is highly age-dependent: young children often regain near-normal nerve function, whereas patients over 60 years old typically recover only protective sensation, such as the ability to distinguish hot from cold or sharp from dull [1]. Adjunctive strategies like localized delivery of soluble neurotrophic factors are under investigation to accelerate axonal regeneration within grafts [1].

Title: Nerve injury
Content: Surgery can be done in case a nerve has become cut or otherwise divided. Recovery of a nerve after surgical repair depends mainly on the age of the patient. Young children can recover close-to-normal nerve function. Title: Neurolytic block
Content: Kizuizi cha neurolytic ni aina ya kizuizi cha ujasiri kinachojumuisha jeraha la makusudi la ujasiri kwa kufungia au inapokanzwa ("neurotomy") au matumizi ya kemikali ("neurolysis"). Uingiliaji huu husababisha kuzorota kwa nyuzi za ujasiri na muda mfupi (miezi michache, kawaida) kuingiliwa na maambukizi ya ishara za ujasiri. Katika taratibu hizi, safu nyembamba ya kinga karibu na nyuzi za mishipa, lamina ya basal, imehifadhiwa ili, kama nyuzi iliyoharibiwa, inasafiri ndani ya bomba lake la lamina ya basal na inaunganisha na mwisho sahihi, na kazi inaweza kurejeshwa. Kukata kwa upasuaji wa ujasiri (neurectomy), huweka mirija hii ya lamina ya basal, na bila wao kugeuza nyuzi zinazoweza kurudi kwenye miunganisho yao iliyopotea, baada ya muda neuroma chungu au maumivu ya deafferentation yanaweza kuibuka. Hii ndio sababu neurolytic kawaida hupendelea juu ya kizuizi cha upasuaji.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Pythagorean theorem
Content: There is debate whether the Pythagorean theorem was discovered once, or many times in many places, and the date of first discovery is uncertain, as is the date of the first proof. According to Joran Friberg, a historian of mathematics, evidence indicates that the Pythagorean theorem "was well-known to the mathematicians of the Old Babylonian period" (20th to 16th centuries BC), which would have been over a thousand years before Pythagoras was born. The history of the theorem can be divided into four parts: knowledge of Pythagorean triples, knowledge of the relationship among the sides of a right triangle, knowledge of the relationships among adjacent angles, and proofs of the theorem within some deductive system.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Andes Chocolate Mints
Content: In 1921, Andrew Kanelos opened a small candy store in Chicago, Illinois. While he initially called his store "Andy's Candies" in reference to himself, he quickly found that men did not like giving boxes of candy with another man's name to their wives and girlfriends. As such, he changed the spelling of the business to "Andes Candies." In 1980, Andes was purchased by the Swiss candy company Interfood (later Jacobs Suchard). When Jacobs Suchard bought Brach's in 1987, Andes became part of that division. When Jacobs Suchard was sold to Kraft General Foods in 1990, Brach's was kept separate by owner Klaus J. Jacobs. In need of cash, Brach's sold Andes to Tootsie Roll Industries in 2000.
---

Title: Charles Andes
Content: Andes alijiunga na rafiki yake Joseph Segel huko Franklin Mint (mint inayozalisha coinage) mnamo 1967, na kuwa makamu wa rais wa kwanza. Mnamo mwaka wa 1970, aliitwa Rais wa Idara yake ya Amerika, na hisa ya Franklin Mint ilianza kuuzwa kwa bidii kwenye Soko la Hisa la New York. Wakati Segel alistaafu mnamo 1973, Andes alikua Mkurugenzi Mtendaji na Mwenyekiti wa Franklin Mint Corporation, ambayo wakati huo ilikuwa imepanuka kimataifa na pia alikuwa akizalisha sarafu ya nchi kadhaa za nje.

Title: Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force
Content: The , JMSDF, also referred to as the Japanese Navy, is the maritime warfare branch of the Japan Self-Defense Forces, tasked with the naval defense of Japan. It is the "de facto" navy of Japan and was formed following the dissolution of the Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) after World War II. The JMSDF has a fleet of 154 ships and 346 aircraft and consists of approximately 45,800 personnel. Its main tasks are to maintain control of the nation's sea lanes and to patrol territorial waters. It also participates in UN-led peacekeeping operations (PKOs) and Maritime Interdiction Operations (MIOs).

Title: World Judo Championships
Content: The World Judo Championships are the highest level of international judo competition, along with the Olympic judo competition. The championships are held once every year (except the years when the Olympics take place) by the International Judo Federation, and qualified judoka compete in their respective categories as representatives of their home countries. Team competitions have also been held since 1994. The men's championships began in 1956, though the format and periodicity of the championships have changed over time. The last edition of the championships took place in Budapest, Hungary in 2017.

Umaarufu wa Judo kati ya wafuasi wa mataifa ya mwenyeji ni kwa sababu ya Glasgow European Open, ambayo ilifanyika mnamo Oktoba 2013. prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Dentures
Content: The fabrication of a set of complete dentures is a challenge for any dentist/denturist. There are many axioms in the production of dentures that must be understood; ignorance of one axiom can lead to failure of the denture. In the vast majority of cases, complete dentures should be comfortable soon after insertion, although almost always at least two adjustment visits are necessary to remove the cause of sore spots. One of the most critical aspects of dentures is that the impression of the denture must be perfectly made and used with perfect technique to make an accurate model of the patient's edentulous (toothless) gums. The dentist or denturist must use a process called border molding to ensure that the denture flanges are properly extended. An array of problems may occur if the final impression of the denture is not made properly. It takes considerable patience and experience for a dentist to know how to make a denture, and for this reason it may be in the patient's best interest to seek a specialist, either a prosthodontist or denturist, to make the denture. A denturist is a trained and licensed professional who sees patients in need of dentures, partials, relines or repairs. A denturist not only takes the impression, but makes the entire denture in his or her own laboratory. The denturist then schedules a date for the delivery of the finished dentures to the patient. A general dentist may do a good job making dentures, but only if he or she is meticulous and experienced. Many dentists no longer make dentures themselves. but instead take an impression of the patients' mouth and then either send the impressions to a dental laboratory, which could be anywhere in the world, or send the patient to a denturist. Once the laboratory receives dental impressions of the patient's mouth, the laboratory creates plaster molds from them. The laboratory uses the molds to create the wax rims used to register the patient's bite. These wax rims are returned to the dentist, who uses them to register the patient's bite. The dentist may assist the patient in choosing the correct size of teeth for the dentures, or simply make the selection himself. Once bite registration is completed and the teeth are selected for the dentures, the wax rim is usually returned to the dental laboratory in order to have the denture teeth set into the wax. Once the teeth are set into the wax rim, the result is a prefinished denture that looks almost like the finished product. This prefinished denture is usually returned to the dentist's office and the patient usually has a chance to approve the setup (for immediate or standard dentures) or to try the denture before it is finished. After approval by the patient, the dentist returns the pre-denture to the laboratory for final processing. The finished denture is then returned to the dentist's office for delivery to the patient.
---

question_en: Why do lions kill their own cubs?
report_en: Male–lion infanticide occurs chiefly when a new dominant male or coalition takes over a pride; by killing nursing cubs that are not his, he removes future rivals and, crucially, causes the mothers to stop lactating and return to estrus sooner, giving him an earlier chance to mate and pass on his own genes, so the behavior is favored by natural selection and persists in the population [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Sociobiology
Content: For example, newly dominant male lions often kill cubs in the pride that they did not sire. This behavior is adaptive because killing the cubs eliminates competition for their own offspring and causes the nursing females to come into heat faster, thus allowing more of his genes to enter into the population. Sociobiologists would view this instinctual cub-killing behavior as being inherited through the genes of successfully reproducing male lions, whereas non-killing behavior may have died out as those lions were less successful in reproducing.

Title: Simba
Content: Wakati wa kwanza kuletwa kwa kiburi kilichobaki, watoto wa simba hawana ujasiri wakati wanakabiliwa na watu wazima isipokuwa mama yao. Hivi karibuni wanaanza kujiingiza katika maisha ya kiburi, hata hivyo, wakicheza kati yao au kujaribu kuanzisha kucheza na watu wazima. Simba na watoto wao wenyewe wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kuwa na uvumilivu wa watoto wengine wa simba kuliko simba bila watoto. Uvumilivu wa kiume wa Cuba hutofautiana - wakati mwingine kiume atawaacha watoto wachanga kucheza na mkia wake au mane yake, wakati mwingine anaweza kuteleza na kufyatua watoto wachanga.
Kuchochea hufanyika baada ya miezi sita au saba. Simba wa kiume hufikia ukomavu wakiwa na umri wa miaka mitatu na kwa miaka nne hadi mitano wana uwezo wa changamoto na kuwaondoa wanaume wazima wanaohusishwa na kiburi kingine. Wanaanza kuzeeka na kudhoofisha wakiwa na umri wa miaka 10 hadi 15 hivi karibuni. Wakati wanaume mmoja au zaidi wapya wakiondoa wanaume wa zamani wanaohusishwa na kiburi, washindi mara nyingi huua watoto wachanga wowote waliopo, labda kwa sababu wanawake hawana rutuba na wanakubali hadi watoto wao wazima au wanakufa. Wanawake mara nyingi hutetea kwa ukali watoto wao kutoka kwa mwanaume anayechukua lakini hawafaulu sana isipokuwa kikundi cha mama watatu au wanne ndani ya vikosi vya kujiunga na vikosi dhidi ya mwanaume. Cuba pia hufa kutokana na njaa na kutelekezwa, na utabiri wa chui, fisi na mbwa mwitu. Hadi 80% ya watoto wa simba watakufa kabla ya umri wa miaka miwili.

claim: In video-game design, “nerfing” refers to deliberately reducing the power, desirability, or overall effectiveness of a specific game element—such as a weapon, ability, or character—in order to improve balance and fairness; the term functions both as a noun (“a nerf”) and a verb (“to nerf”)
question_en: What does nerfing mean?
report_en: In video-game design, “nerfing” refers to deliberately reducing the power, desirability, or overall effectiveness of a specific game element—such as a weapon, ability, or character—in order to improve balance and fairness; the term functions both as a noun (“a nerf”) and a verb (“to nerf”) [1]. The expression originated among players of the 1997 MMORPG Ultima Online, where frustrated users likened weakened virtual weapons to foam Nerf-brand toys whose soft projectiles are unlikely to cause serious harm, highlighting how the adjustment makes an element less threatening without removing it entirely [1].

The first established use of the term was in "Ultima Online", as a reference to the Nerf brand of toys whose bullets are soft and less likely to cause serious injury.

Title: Vita vya Nerf
Content: Vita vya NERF ni shughuli inayohusisha Blasters za Nerf au silaha zingine za kurusha povu. Vita vya Nerf vinaweza kuwa michezo mingi, kutoka kwa risasi zisizo rasmi katika ofisi na basement hadi vita vilivyoandaliwa vizuri na blasters zilizo na nguvu nyingi. Kwa kuwa bunduki za kurusha povu ni salama na bei rahisi, vita vya Nerf vinaweza kujumuisha washiriki na uwanja wa vita vinginevyo haifai kwa Airsoft na mpira wa rangi.
Vita vya Nerf vinaweza kuchukua mahali popote. Sehemu yoyote iliyo na usawa mzuri wa nafasi wazi na kifuniko kinaweza kuwa mgombea. Basement, ofisi, na uwanja wa nyuma ni maeneo ya kawaida kwa michezo isiyo rasmi. Kwa vita vikubwa na washiriki zaidi, kumbi kubwa kama mazoezi ya mazoezi, mbuga za umma, misitu, mito, na shule hufanya maeneo mazuri ya kucheza. Ndani ya ukumbi mkubwa kama chumba inaweza kugeuzwa kuwa uwanja wa vita kwa kugeuza meza pande zao. Wakati wa kupanga vita vya NERF katika eneo la umma, mratibu kawaida huhifadhi nafasi hiyo na hutazama kwa washiriki wasio washiriki ili kupunguza dhima yoyote. Uwezo wa kucheza katika maeneo ya bure ni sehemu muhimu ya upatikanaji wa vita vya Nerf.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Game Show Network
Content: Game Show Network launched at 7:00 p.m. ET on December 1, 1994. The first aired game show was "What's My Line?". From 1994 until about 1997, the network aired classic pre-1972 game shows as well as game shows made after 1972, most of which came from the Mark Goodson–Bill Todman library. The network aired game shows in a 24-hour cycle, and also used live interstitials as wraparound programming. In its first few months, GSN's commercials consisted of public service announcements (PSAs), promotions for its programming and commercials related to network parent company Sony. By 1995, when the network began to expand, the network began accepting conventional advertising as it gained new sponsorships. On March 17, 1997, the Game Show Network rebranded with a new presentation package and a new logo (which had the network's name in boxes and a colorful swirling ball) and a new slogan "All Play, All Day". While the logo changed, its programming remained unchanged, the network also debuted new promos and new idents on that day, which were designed by graphics agency Lee Hunt Associates.

Mnamo mwaka wa 1999, mtandao ulianza slate ya programu ya asili, pamoja na "Uchunguzi", "Umati wote mpya wa 3, na" Hollywood Showdown ". Kituo pia kilizindua vipindi vya asili kama "Extreme Gong" (kumbukumbu ya "show ya gong" ya kawaida). Mnamo 2000, mtandao ulikabiliwa na marudio mengine wakati GSN ilipoteza haki ya kutangaza "Bei ni sawa", na sehemu ya mwisho ya kuangazia Aprili 3 ya mwaka huo.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Specialty drugs in the United States
Content: Specialty drugs or specialty pharmaceuticals are a recent designation of pharmaceuticals that are classified as high-cost, high complexity and/or high touch. Specialty drugs are often biologics—"drugs derived from living cells" that are injectable or infused (although some are oral medications). They are used to treat complex or rare chronic conditions such as cancer, rheumatoid arthritis, hemophilia, H.I.V. psoriasis, inflammatory bowel disease and hepatitis C. In 1990 there were 10 specialty drugs on the market, in the mid-1990s there were fewer than 30, by 2008 there were 200, and by 2015 there were 300. Drugs are often defined as specialty because their price is much higher than that of non-specialty drugs. Medicare defines any drug for which the negotiated price is $670 per month or more, as a specialty drug which is placed in a specialty tier that requires a higher patient cost sharing. Drugs are also identified as specialty when there is a special handling requirement or the drug is only available via a limited distributions network. By 2015 "specialty medications accounted for one-third of all spending on drugs in the United States, up from 19 percent in 2004 and heading toward 50 percent in the next 10 years", according to IMS Health, which tracks prescriptions. According to a 2010 article in Forbes, specialty drugs for rare diseases became more expensive "than anyone imagined" and their success came "at a time when the traditional drug business of selling medicines to the masses" was "in decline". In 2015 analysis by "The Wall Street Journal" suggested the large premium was due to the perceived value of rare disease treatments which usually are very expensive when compared to treatments for more common diseases.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Bangkok Noi District
Content: Bangkok Noi was established as an amphoe on 15 October 1915. Originally named Amphoe Ammarin, it was renamed on 11 July 1916 to Amphoe Bangkok Noi to match with the historical name of the area. It became a khet in 1972 when Thon Buri and Bangkok were merged. Later on 9 November 1989 the Bang Phlat district was created from four of Bangkok Noi's sub-districts, leaving Bangkok Noi with four remaining sub-districts: Siri Rat, Ban Chang Lo, Bang Khun Non, and Bang Khun Si. On 12 December 1991 a small part of Bang Phlat district was moved back to Bangkok Noi, creating the new Arun Ammarin sub-district.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: History of the Otago Region
Content: The precise date at which the first inhabitants of New Zealand reached Otago and the extreme south (known to later Māori as "Murihiku") remains uncertain. Māori descend from a race of Polynesian sea-wanderers who, moved from East Asia and south-east Asia to the islands of the Pacific. Tradition tells of their further journeyings from Hawaiki to New Zealand, and some commentators have identified this homeland as Havai'i, an island in the Society Group. Overpopulation, scarcity of food and civil war forced many of them to migrate once more, and New Zealand became their new home. Māori settled New Zealand between AD 1280–1320. They quickly learnt to hunt the numerous species of moa and seals in New Zealand and settled across the North and South islands in less than a few decades. There is a change in the pollen record from inland Otago from 600 years ago from a forest to bracken flora. It has been inferred that this relates to fires being lit during Maori exploration.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Historia ya New Zealand
Content: Historia ya New Zealand ilianzia angalau miaka 700 hadi ilipogunduliwa na kutulia na Polynesians, ambao walitengeneza utamaduni tofauti wa Māori uliolenga viungo vya ujamaa na ardhi. Mvumbuzi wa kwanza wa Ulaya kuona New Zealand alikuwa msafiri wa Uholanzi Abel Tasman mnamo 13 Desemba 1642. Waholanzi pia walikuwa wa kwanza wasiokuwa wa kwanza kuchunguza na kuorodhesha pwani ya New Zealand. Kapteni James Cook, ambaye alifika New Zealand mnamo Oktoba 1769 mnamo safari yake ya kwanza tatu, alikuwa mchunguzi wa kwanza wa Ulaya kuzunguka na ramani New Zealand. Kuanzia mwishoni mwa karne ya 18, nchi hiyo ilitembelewa mara kwa mara na wachunguzi na mabaharia wengine, wamishonari, wafanyabiashara na watangazaji. Mnamo 1840 Mkataba wa Waitangi ulitiwa saini kati ya taji ya Uingereza na wakuu mbali mbali wa Māori, na kuleta New Zealand katika Dola ya Uingereza na kumpa Māori haki sawa na raia wa Uingereza. Kulikuwa na makazi ya Briteni kwa muda wote wa karne na mwanzoni mwa karne ijayo. Vita na kuwekwa kwa mfumo wa kiuchumi na kisheria wa Ulaya ulisababisha ardhi nyingi za New Zealand kupita kutoka Māori kwenda kwa umiliki wa Pākehā (Uropa), na baadaye Māori wakawa masikini.

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Cricket bat
Content: The "blade" of a cricket bat is a wooden block that is generally flat on the striking face and with a ridge on the reverse (back) which concentrates wood in the middle where the ball is generally hit. The bat is traditionally made from willow wood, specifically from a variety of white willow called cricket bat willow ("Salix alba" var. "caerulea"), treated with raw (unboiled) linseed oil, which has a protective function. This variety of willow is used as it is very tough and shock-resistant, not being significantly dented nor splintering on the impact of a cricket ball at high speed, while also being light in weight. The face of the bat is often covered with a protective film by the user.
---

Tangu tukio hilo la mapigano, jaribio la uuzaji lililotangazwa sana la Dennis Lillee, ambaye alitoa kofia ya alumini wakati wa mchezo wa kimataifa, sheria zimetoa kwamba blade ya bat lazima ifanyike kwa kuni.

Umpires pia ni wasuluhishi wa ikiwa lami ni sawa kwa kucheza, na ikiwa wataona kuwa haifai, kwa idhini ya maafisa wote wanaweza kubadilisha lami. Cricket ya kitaalam karibu kila wakati inachezwa kwenye uso wa nyasi. Walakini, katika tukio ambalo lami isiyo ya turf inatumika, uso wa bandia lazima uwe na urefu wa chini na upana wa chini wa.

claim: If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins
question_en: What happens when the president and VP of the USA die?
report_en: If a sitting President and Vice President die simultaneously, the Presidential Succession Act makes the Speaker of the House the next in line; if the Speaker is unwilling or constitutionally ineligible, succession passes to the President pro tempore of the Senate and then through Cabinet officers in a fixed order, each of whom must resign any congressional seat and meet the constitutional requirements for the presidency. If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1]. Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].
all_claims: If a sitting President and Vice President die simultaneously, the Presidential Succession Act makes the Speaker of the House the next in line; if the Speaker is unwilling or constitutionally ineligible, succession passes to the President pro tempore of the Senate and then through Cabinet officers in a fixed order, each of whom must resign any congressional seat and meet the constitutional requirements for the presidency.

If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1].

Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].
claims_retained: If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1].

Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: President-elect of the United States
Content: If the Vice President-elect dies or resigns "before" the meeting of the Electoral College in December, the National Committee of the winning party would, in consultation with the president-elect, choose a replacement to receive the electoral votes of the Vice Presidential nominee in the same manner as would happen if the former Vice Presidential nominee had become President-elect due to the death of the apparent winner. Assuming the requisite number the electors agreed to vote for the replacement candidate, that person would then become the Vice President-elect. If such a vacancy were to occur "after" the electoral votes had been cast in the states, most authorities maintain that no replacement would be chosen and the new President (after taking office) would nominate a Vice President, per the provisions of the Twenty-fifth Amendment to the Constitution.
---

Title: Katiba ya Merika

Inazidisha sheria ya mfululizo wa kufanikiwa iliyoanzishwa. Mpango halisi wa mfululizo umehitajika mara kadhaa tangu 1789. Walakini, kwa karibu 20% ya historia ya Merika, hakujakuwa na makamu wa rais katika ofisi ambaye anaweza kudhani urais.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Horse
Content: Depending on breed, management and environment, the modern domestic horse has a life expectancy of 25 to 30 years. Uncommonly, a few animals live into their 40s and, occasionally, beyond. The oldest verifiable record was "Old Billy", a 19th-century horse that lived to the age of 62. In modern times, Sugar Puff, who had been listed in "Guinness World Records" as the world's oldest living pony, died in 2007 at age 56.

claim: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation
question_en: Does Buddhism believe in Jesus?
report_en: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1]. While Christianity places monotheism and the crucifixion of Jesus, viewed as the once-for-all atonement for sin, at the center of faith, these concepts have no doctrinal counterpart in Buddhism, whose teachings focus instead on personal karma, the Four Noble Truths, and the Eightfold Path [1]. Individual Buddhists might respect Jesus as an ethical teacher, but traditional Buddhist scriptures neither mention him nor attribute salvific significance to his life or death.
all_claims: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1].

While Christianity places monotheism and the crucifixion of Jesus, viewed as the once-for-all atonement for sin, at the center of faith, these concepts have no doctrinal counterpart in Buddhism, whose teachings focus instead on personal karma, the Four Noble Truths, and the Eightfold Path [1].
Individual Buddhists might respect Jesus as an ethical teacher, but traditional Buddhist scriptures neither mention him nor attribute salvific significance to his life or death.
claims_retained: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1].

While Christianity places monotheism and the crucifixion of Jesus, viewed as the once-for-all atonement for sin, at the center of faith, these concepts have no doctrinal counterpart in Buddhism, whose teachings focus instead on personal karma, the Four Noble Truths, and the Eightfold Path [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Buddhism and Christianity
Content: Although analogies have been drawn between Buddhism and Christianity, there are differences between the two religions beginning with monotheism's place at the core of Christianity, and Buddhism's orientation towards non-theism (the lack of relevancy of the existence of a creator deity) which runs counter to teachings about God in Christianity; and extending to the importance of grace in Christianity against the rejection of interference with karma in Theravada Buddhism, etc. Another difference between the two traditions is the Christian belief in the centrality of the crucifixion of Jesus as a single event believed to act as the atonement of sins and its direct contrast to Buddhist teachings.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Shinji Takahashi (Kiongozi wa Kidini)
Content: Takahashi alihubiri kwamba Ubuddha na Ukristo katika wakati huu wa sasa umekuwa wasomi, au rasmi, na kubadilishwa kuwa imani kulingana na nguvu zingine. Kujibu hili, alitetea kurudi nyakati za Gotama Siddhartha na Yesu Kristo katika kazi zake nyingi za fasihi, akianza na "" Ningen/Shaka "" ("Binadamu/Gotama Buddha"). Kwa kuongezea, Takahashi alisisitiza kwamba Yesu Kristo wala Gotama Siddhartha walihubiri mawazo ya nguvu zingine, na kwamba Ukristo na Ubuddha katika nyakati zao hazikuwa ngumu kama Ukristo na Ubuddha wa leo. Kuhusiana na mawazo ya nguvu zingine zinazoshawishi dini hizi, sheria hizi za asili (msingi safi wa kidini wa Ubudha, Uislamu, na Ukristo) zilibadilishwa kwa sababu ya nia ya wale ambao walikuwa madarakani kwa wakati, na tafsiri za wasomi wengi; Cores za sheria hizi za maumbile zilipotea, nadharia mbali mbali zilichanganywa, na zilibadilishwa kwa njia ngumu na kupoteza mali zao. Kwa kuongezea, sheria hizi za maumbile zilipotoshwa kwa makusudi na kupelekwa kwa watu kwa madhumuni ya faida ya mtu binafsi, na watu walifanywa kuamini kwamba wale ambao walizuia hii watafikiwa na mashtaka madhubuti. Seti hii mpya ya sheria zilizopotoka zilionekana polepole kama sheria za maumbile kama inavyofundishwa katika matoleo ya leo ya dini hizo.

claim: Spanish is officially spoken in 23 countries, corresponding to the 23 national academies that make up the Association of Spanish Language Academies, including Spain, Mexico, Colombia, Argentina, and others across Latin America, the Caribbean, the United States, the Philippines, and Equatorial Guinea
question_en: How many countries speak Spanish?
report_en: Spanish is officially spoken in 23 countries, corresponding to the 23 national academies that make up the Association of Spanish Language Academies, including Spain, Mexico, Colombia, Argentina, and others across Latin America, the Caribbean, the United States, the Philippines, and Equatorial Guinea [1].
all_claims: Spanish is officially spoken in 23 countries, corresponding to the 23 national academies that make up the Association of Spanish Language Academies, including Spain, Mexico, Colombia, Argentina, and others across Latin America, the Caribbean, the United States, the Philippines, and Equatorial Guinea [1].
claims_retained: Spanish is officially spoken in 23 countries, corresponding to the 23 national academies that make up the Association of Spanish Language Academies, including Spain, Mexico, Colombia, Argentina, and others across Latin America, the Caribbean, the United States, the Philippines, and Equatorial Guinea [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Spanish language
Content: The Association of Spanish Language Academies (, or ) is the entity which regulates the Spanish language. It was created in Mexico in 1951 and represents the union of all the separate academies in the Spanish-speaking world. It comprises the academies of 23 countries, ordered by date of Academy foundation: Spain (1713), Colombia (1871), Ecuador (1874), Mexico (1875), El Salvador (1876), Venezuela (1883), Chile (1885), Peru (1887), Guatemala (1887), Costa Rica (1923), Philippines (1924), Panama (1926), Cuba (1926),
Paraguay (1927), Dominican Republic (1927), Bolivia (1927), Nicaragua (1928), Argentina (1931), Uruguay (1943), Honduras (1949), Puerto Rico (1955), United States (1973) and Equatorial Guinea (2016).
The (Cervantes Institute) is a worldwide nonprofit organization created by the Spanish government in 1991. This organization has branched out in over 20 different countries, with 54 centers devoted to the Spanish and Hispanic American cultures and Spanish language. The ultimate goals of the Institute are to promote universally the education, the study, and the use of Spanish as a second language, to support methods and activities that help the process of Spanish-language education, and to contribute to the advancement of the Spanish and Hispanic American cultures in non-Spanish-speaking countries. The Institute's 2015 report "El español, una lengua viva" (Spanish, a living language) estimates that there are 559 million Spanish speakers worldwide. Among the sources cited in the report is the U.S. Census Bureau, which estimates that the U.S. will have 138 million Spanish speakers by 2050, making it the biggest Spanish-speaking nation on earth, with Spanish the mother tongue of almost a third of its citizens.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Nicaraguans
Content: Kihispania huzungumzwa na karibu 90% ya idadi ya watu wa nchi hiyo. Katika Nicaragua fomu ya Voseo ni ya kawaida, kama ilivyo katika nchi zingine za Amerika ya Kati na Kusini kama Honduras, Argentina, Uruguay au Colombia ya Pwani. Kihispania ina lahaja nyingi tofauti zinazozungumzwa katika Amerika ya Kusini, Amerika ya Kati ni lahaja inayozungumzwa huko Nicaragua. Katika pwani ya Karibiani wengi wa Afro-Nicaraguans na Creoles huongea Kiingereza na Kiingereza cha Kiingereza kama lugha yao ya kwanza. Pia katika pwani ya Karibiani, watu wengi asilia huzungumza lugha zao za asili, kama lugha ya Miskito, Sumo, Rama na Garifuna. Kwa kuongezea, makabila mengi huko Nicaragua, kama vile Wanicaragua wa China na Wapalestina wa Wapalestina, wametunza lugha za mababu zao, ambazo ni lugha ndogo, wakati pia zinazungumza Kihispania na/au Kiingereza. Lugha hizi ndogo ni pamoja na Wachina, Kiarabu, Kijerumani, na Italia, miongoni mwa zingine.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Eurasian eagle-owl
Content: The Eurasian eagle-owl ("Bubo bubo") is a species of eagle-owl that resides in much of Eurasia. It is also called the European eagle-owl and in Europe, it is occasionally abbreviated to just eagle-owl. It is one of the largest species of owl, and females can grow to a total length of 75 cm (30 in), with a wingspan of 188 cm (6 ft 2 in), males being slightly smaller. This bird has distinctive ear tufts, with upper parts that are mottled with darker blackish colouring and tawny. The wings and tail are barred. The underparts are a variably hued buff, streaked with darker colour. The facial disc is poorly developed and the orange eyes are distinctive.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Eagle-owl ya Eurasian
Content: Eagle-owl ya Eurasian ni ndege mkubwa sana, ndogo kuliko tai ya dhahabu ("Aquila chrysaetos") lakini kubwa kuliko bundi wa theluji, licha ya kuongezeka kwa ukubwa na spishi zote mbili. Wakati mwingine hujulikana kama bundi mkubwa zaidi ulimwenguni, ingawa bundi wa samaki wa Blakiston ("B. blakistoni") ni mzito kidogo kwa wastani na uzani mwepesi mkubwa wa kijivu ("Strix nebulosa") ni kidogo kwa wastani. Heimo Mikkola aliripoti vielelezo vikubwa zaidi vya tai-owl kuwa na misa ya juu ya mwili, kama bundi mkubwa wa samaki wa Blakiston na alipata urefu wa muda mrefu. Kwa upande wa uzito wa wastani na saizi ya mrengo, Blakiston ndio spishi kubwa zaidi, hata inazidi kuwa kubwa katika mambo haya kuliko jamii kubwa ya Eagle-Owl kutoka Urusi. Pia, ingawa ni fupi kuliko kubwa zaidi ya spishi za mwisho, Eagle-Owl ya Eurasian inaweza kupima zaidi ya mara mbili kama vile bundi mkubwa wa kijivu. Eagle-owl ya Eurasian kawaida ina mabawa ya, na vielelezo vikubwa zaidi vinaweza kufikia. Urefu wa spishi unaweza kutofautiana kutoka. Wanawake wanaweza kupima kutoka na wanaume wanaweza kupima. Kwa kulinganisha, bundi wa ghalani ("Tyto alba"), aina ya bundi iliyosambazwa zaidi ulimwenguni, ina uzito wa 500 g (1.1 lb) na bundi mkubwa wa pembe ("Bubo Virginianus"), ambayo inajaza niche ya mazingira ya Eagle-owl huko Amerika Kaskazini, inazunguka karibu 1.4 kg (3.1 lb).

Title: SS Great Eastern
Content: SS "Great Eastern" was an iron sailing steamship designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel, and built by J. Scott Russell & Co. at Millwall Iron Works on the River Thames, London. She was by far the largest ship ever built at the time of her 1858 launch, and had the capacity to carry 4,000 passengers from England to Australia without refuelling. Her length of was only surpassed in 1899 by the 17,274-gross-ton RMS "Oceanic", her gross tonnage of 18,915 was only surpassed in 1901 by the 21,035-gross-ton RMS "Celtic", and her 4,000-passenger capacity was surpassed in 1913 by the 4,935-passenger SS "Imperator". The ship's five funnels were rare. These were later reduced to four.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Jonathan Swift
Content: Jonathan Swift was born on 30 November 1667 in Dublin, Ireland. He was the second child and only son of Jonathan Swift (1640–1667) and his wife Abigail Erick (or Herrick) of Frisby on the Wreake. His father was a native of Goodrich, Herefordshire, but he accompanied his brothers to Ireland to seek their fortunes in law after their Royalist father's estate was brought to ruin during the English Civil War. His maternal grandfather, James Ericke, was the vicar of Thornton, England. In 1634 the vicar was convicted of Puritan practices. Some time thereafter, Ericke and his family, including his young daughter Abilgail, fled to Ireland.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Hadithi ya tub
Content: Mzaliwa wa wazazi wa Kiingereza huko Ireland, Jonathan Swift alikuwa akifanya kazi kama katibu wa Sir William Temple wakati huo aliunda "Tale ya Tub" (1694-161697). Uchapishaji wa kazi hiyo uliambatana na Swift akijigonga peke yake, akiwa na tamaa ya kupata "kuishi" nzuri kutoka kwa ushawishi wa Hekaluni au Hekaluni. Kuna uvumi juu ya nini kilisababisha ugomvi kati ya Swift na mwajiri wake, lakini, kama A. C. Elias anashangaza, inaonekana kwamba majani ya mwisho yalikuja na kazi ya Swift kwenye "Barua" za Hekaluni. Swift alikuwa ameshirikiana kutafsiri mawasiliano ya Ufaransa ya Hekaluni, lakini hekalu, au mtu aliye karibu na hekalu, alihariri maandishi ya Ufaransa ili kufanya hekalu ionekane ya kitabia na ya ufasaha zaidi. Kwa hivyo, barua na tafsiri Swift zilizotolewa hazikufanya, na, kwa kuwa Swift hakuweza kushtaki Hekaluni kwa kuiba barua zake, na kwa sababu umma hautawahi kuamini kwamba waziri wa serikali aliyestaafu alikuwa amesema uwongo, Swift aligundua kuwa hana uwezo.
Hata ingawa Swift alichapisha "hadithi" wakati alipoacha huduma ya Hekalu, ilichukuliwa mapema, na kitabu hicho ni salvo katika moja ya vita vya Hekaluni. Polemic ya jumla ya Swift inahusu hoja ("ugomvi wa watu wa zamani na wa kisasa") ambayo ilikuwa imekwisha kwa karibu miaka kumi na wakati kitabu kilichapishwa. "Ugomvi wa watu wa zamani na wa kisasa" ulikuwa mjadala wa kitaaluma wa Ufaransa wa miaka ya 1690, ulisababisha Fontenelle akisema kwamba usomi wa kisasa ulimruhusu mwanadamu wa kisasa kuzidi wazee katika maarifa. Hekalu liligombana dhidi ya msimamo huu katika "juu ya ujifunzaji wake wa zamani na wa kisasa" (ambapo alitoa muundo wa kwanza wa Kiingereza wa mahali pa kawaida kwamba wakosoaji wa kisasa wanaona tu kwa sababu ni vibanda vilivyosimama juu ya mabega ya makubwa), na insha ya Hekalu isiyo na maana ilisababisha majibu madogo. Kati ya wengine, watu wawili ambao walichukua upande wa kupinga hekalu walikuwa Richard Bentley (mtaalam na mhariri) na William Wotton (mkosoaji).

Title: Lake Michigan
Content: Lake Michigan has a surface area of 22,404 sq.mi (58,026 km); (13,237 square miles, 34,284 km lying in Michigan state, 7,358 square miles, 19,056 km in Wisconsin, 234 square miles, 606 km in Indiana, & 1,576 square miles, 4,079 km in Illinois) making it the largest lake entirely within one country by surface area (Lake Baikal, in Russia, is larger by water volume), and the fifth-largest lake in the world. It is the larger half of Lake Michigan–Huron, which is the largest body of fresh water in the world by surface area. It is long by wide with a shoreline long. The lake's average depth is 46 fathoms 3 feet (279 ft; 85 m), while its greatest depth is 153 fathoms 5 feet (923 ft; 281 m). It contains a volume of 1,180 cubic miles (4,918 km³) of water. Green Bay in the northwest is its largest bay. Grand Traverse Bay in its northeast is another large bay. Lake Michigan's deepest region, which lies in its northern-half, is called Chippewa Basin (named after prehistoric Lake Chippewa) and is separated from South Chippewa Basin, by a relatively shallower area called the Mid Lake Plateau.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Optic nerve
Content: The optic nerve leaves the orbit (eye socket) via the optic canal, running postero-medially towards the optic chiasm, where there is a partial decussation (crossing) of fibers from the temporal visual fields (the nasal hemi-retina) of both eyes. The proportion of decussating fibers varies between species, and is correlated with the degree of binocular vision enjoyed by a species. Most of the axons of the optic nerve terminate in the lateral geniculate nucleus from where information is relayed to the visual cortex, while other axons terminate in the pretectal nucleus and are involved in reflexive eye movements. Other axons terminate in the suprachiasmatic nucleus and are involved in regulating the sleep-wake cycle. Its diameter increases from about 1.6 mm within the eye to 3.5 mm in the orbit to 4.5 mm within the cranial space. The optic nerve component lengths are 1 mm in the globe, 24 mm in the orbit, 9 mm in the optic canal, and 16 mm in the cranial space before joining the optic chiasm. There, partial decussation occurs, and about 53% of the fibers cross to form the optic tracts. Most of these fibers terminate in the lateral geniculate body.
---

Kama matokeo, nyuzi za ujasiri wa macho zinafunikwa na myelin zinazozalishwa na oligodendrocyte, badala ya seli za Schwann za mfumo wa neva wa pembeni, na zimefungwa ndani ya meninges. Neuropathies ya pembeni kama ugonjwa wa Guillain -Barré haiathiri ujasiri wa macho. Walakini, kawaida ujasiri wa macho huwekwa na mishipa mingine kumi na moja ya cranial na inachukuliwa kuwa sehemu ya mfumo wa neva wa pembeni.

Title: Kanisa kuu la Westminster
Content: Mwanzilishi wa Kanisa kuu la Westminster, Kardinali Herbert Vaughan alisisitiza sana juu ya uzuri na uadilifu wa liturujia ya kanisa kuu. Hapo awali, aliamua kuwe na jamii ya watawa wa Benedictine kwenye kanisa kuu mpya, wakifanya liturujia na kuimba ofisi ya kila siku. Hii ilisababisha chuki kubwa kati ya makasisi wa kidunia wa dayosisi, ambao waliona walikuwa wakinyang'anywa. Mwishowe, mazungumzo na Benedictines ya Kiingereza na jamii ya Benedictines ya Ufaransa huko Farnborough ilishindwa na kwaya ya 'jadi' ya wanaume na wavulana ilianzishwa badala yake. Licha ya shida kubwa za kifedha, shule ya kwaya ilifunguliwa mnamo 5 Oktoba 1901 na chorista kumi na moja, katika jengo hilo hapo awali lililokusudiwa kwa watawa wa Benedictine. Kardinali Vaughan alipokea wavulana na maneno "Wewe ndiye Mawe ya Msingi". Kwaya ya Kanisa kuu ilianzishwa rasmi miezi mitatu baadaye mnamo Januari 1902. Masheikh na ofisi zilizoimbwa zilianzishwa mara moja wakati Kanisa kuu lilifunguliwa kwa ibada mnamo 1903, na zimeendelea bila usumbufu tangu hapo. Leo, kwaya ya Kanisa Kuu la Westminster ndio kwaya ya kitaalam ya Katoliki tu ulimwenguni kuimba Misa ya kila siku na Vespers.

prompt:

Title: Molar mass
Content: Molecular masses are calculated from the standard atomic weights of each nuclide, while molar masses are calculated from the atomic mass of each element. The atomic mass takes into account the isotopic distribution of the element in a given sample (usually assumed to be "normal"). For example, water has a molar mass of 18.0153(3) g/mol, but individual water molecules have molecular masses which range between 18.010 564 6863(15) u (HO) and 22.027 7364(9) u (DO).

Wakati misombo ya mumunyifu wa maji kwa ujumla hutengana kwa uhuru kwenye membrane ya microdialysis, hali sio wazi kwa uchambuzi wa lipophilic, ambapo wote waliofanikiwa (k.m. corticosteroids) na majaribio ya microdialysis yasiyofanikiwa (k.m. estradil, asidi ya fusidic) yameripotiwa. Title: History of Dutch nationality
Content: Even though urban governments showed rare signs of democracy they were primarily an oligarchic system marked by an exclusive hierarchy. Class divisions, however were not as deep as in other European states, and the rights that the common class possessed did not differ much from what the intellectuals could practice. There was a cultural harmony and it prevented the formation of two completely divided classes and allowed for a social participation of all. Similarly, the basis of education was the same for all, and this allowed for a social bond. The difference in rights that the upper and lower classes possessed was reduced to the amount of money available to the individual. If one was wealthy, he could afford higher-level education. However, this alone did not earn him any political privileges or extensive political rights but only the ability to earn more wealth. 
The whole population of the Dutch Republic did not have the choice of voting for the representative of the Country inasmuch as there was not a choice between a democracy and an aristocracy but rather between an aristocracy and a monarchy. The stadtholder would be a member of the House of Orange-Nassau.

question_en: Who first identified the cell?

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Cell theory
Content: In biology, cell theory is the historic scientific theory, now universally accepted, that living organisms are made up of cells, that they are the basic structural/organizational unit of all organisms, and that all cells come from pre-existing cells. Cells are the basic unit of structure in all organisms and also the basic unit of reproduction. With continual improvements made to microscopes over time, magnification technology advanced enough to discover cells in the 17th century. This discovery is largely attributed to Robert Hooke, and began the scientific study of cells, also known as cell biology. Over a century later, many debates about cells began amongst scientists. Most of these debates involved the nature of cellular regeneration, and the idea of cells as a fundamental unit of life. Cell theory was eventually formulated in 1839. This is usually credited to Matthias Schleiden and Theodor Schwann. However, many other scientists like Rudolf Virchow contributed to the theory. It was an important step in the movement away from spontaneous generation.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Chuo Kikuu cha Toronto
Content: Ugunduzi wa insulini katika Chuo Kikuu cha Toronto mnamo 1921 unazingatiwa kati ya matukio muhimu zaidi katika historia ya dawa. Kiini cha shina kiligunduliwa katika Chuo Kikuu mnamo 1963, na kutengeneza msingi wa kupandikiza kwa mfupa na utafiti wote wa baadaye juu ya seli za shina za watu wazima na embryonic. Hii ilikuwa ya kwanza ya matokeo mengi huko Toronto yanayohusiana na seli za shina, pamoja na kitambulisho cha seli za kongosho na shina. Kiini cha saratani kilitambuliwa kwanza mnamo 1997 na watafiti wa Toronto, ambao wamepata vyama vya seli za shina katika leukemia, tumors za ubongo na saratani ya colorectal. Uvumbuzi wa matibabu ulioandaliwa huko Toronto ni pamoja na faharisi ya glycemic, pablum ya nafaka ya watoto, matumizi ya hypothermia ya kinga katika upasuaji wa moyo wazi na pacemaker ya kwanza ya moyo. Upandikizaji wa kwanza wa mapafu moja ulifanywa huko Toronto mnamo 1981, ikifuatiwa na upandikizaji wa kwanza wa ujasiri mnamo 1988, na upandikizaji wa kwanza wa mapafu mara mbili mnamo 1989. Watafiti waligundua sababu ya kukuza kukomaa ambayo inasimamia mgawanyiko wa seli, na kugundua receptor ya T-seli, ambayo husababisha majibu ya mfumo wa kinga. Chuo kikuu kinapewa sifa ya kutenganisha jeni inayosababisha anemia ya Fanconi, cystic fibrosis na ugonjwa wa alzheimer wa mapema, kati ya magonjwa mengine mengi. Kati ya 1914 na 1972, Chuo Kikuu kiliendesha Maabara ya Utafiti wa Matibabu ya Connaught, ambayo sasa ni sehemu ya Shirika la Madawa Sanofi-Aventis. Kati ya utafiti uliofanywa katika maabara ni maendeleo ya electrophoresis ya gel.

question_en: What is the temperature of Uranus?

all_claims: The coldest measured temperature in Uranus’s atmosphere occurs at its tropopause, where it drops to about 49 K (−224 °C), making Uranus the coldest known planet in the Solar System [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Climate of Uranus
Content: Several solutions have been proposed to explain the calm weather on Uranus. One proposed explanation for this dearth of cloud features is that Uranus's internal heat appears markedly lower than that of the other giant planets; in astronomical terms, it has a low internal thermal flux. Why Uranus's heat flux is so low is still not understood. Neptune, which is Uranus's near twin in size and composition, radiates 2.61 times as much energy into space as it receives from the Sun. Uranus, by contrast, radiates hardly any excess heat at all. The total power radiated by Uranus in the far infrared (i.e. heat) part of the spectrum is times the solar energy absorbed in its atmosphere. In fact, Uranus's heat flux is only  W/m², which is lower than the internal heat flux of Earth of about 0.075 W/m². The lowest temperature recorded in Uranus's tropopause is 49 K (−224 °C), making Uranus the coldest planet in the Solar System, colder than Neptune.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Uranus
Content: Joto la ndani la Uranus linaonekana kuwa chini sana kuliko ile ya sayari zingine kubwa; Kwa maneno ya angani, ina flux ya chini ya mafuta. Kwa nini joto la ndani la Uranus ni chini sana bado halijaeleweka. Neptune, ambayo ni mapacha wa karibu wa Uranus kwa ukubwa na muundo, huangaza mara 2.61 nishati nyingi ndani ya nafasi kama inavyopokea kutoka kwa jua, lakini Uranus haitoi joto yoyote ya ziada. Nguvu jumla iliyoangaziwa na Uranus katika sehemu ya mbali (i.e. joto) sehemu ya wigo ni nyakati za nishati ya jua inayoingizwa katika anga yake. Flux ya joto ya Uranus ni tu, ambayo ni chini kuliko flux ya joto ya ndani ya Dunia ya karibu. Joto la chini kabisa lililorekodiwa katika tropopause ya Uranus ni, na kufanya Uranus kuwa sayari baridi zaidi katika mfumo wa jua.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Koa'e Fault Zone
Content: The Koa’e Fault Zone (pronounced coe-wah-hee) is a series of fault scarps connecting the East and Southwest Rift Zones on Kilauea Volcano on the Big Island of Hawaii. The fault zone intersects the East Rift near the Pauahi Crater and extends nearly 12 kilometers in an east-northeast direction towards the westernmost boundary near Mauna Iki and the Southwest Rift Zone. Boundaries of the Koa’e Fault Zone also cover 2 kilometers in a north-south orientation along the 12 kilometer length. It is believed that the fault zone has been active for tens of thousands of years. The area is infrequently visited by park patrons due to the lack of eruptive activity and closure of certain areas to the general public.
